intro: Rheedia albuquerquei, commonly known as the Albuquerque rheedia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers, which bloom during the dry season. It typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Rheedia albuquerquei is adapted to survive in harsh, nutrient-poor soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
